product.title: Nonprofit Success Pack (NPSP)
product.short_description: The Foundation for the Connected Nonprofit
product.description:
## Welcome to the Nonprofit Success Pack installer!

**IMPORTANT**: Salesforce does not recommend installing upgrades directly in production organizations. Instead, install your NPSP upgrade in one of your free sandbox environments, or a developer organization first.

**If you are upgrading from NPSP 2, you will need to do a step *before* running this installer. First, upgrade only the Recurring Donations package to version 3.10 by running the installer:**

* [Install Recurring Donations 3.10 in Production or Developer Edition orgs](https://login.salesforce.com/packaging/installPackage.apexp?p0=04t80000000tpCB)
* [Install Recurring Donations 3.10 in Sandbox orgs](https://test.salesforce.com/packaging/installPackage.apexp?p0=04t80000000tpCB)

Be sure to Install for All Users and follow the prompts. Once the Recurring Donations package has been updated, you can proceed with the complete installation of Nonprofit Success Pack here. If you do not upgrade the Recurring Donations package first, you will get an error in the installer that can only be resolved by installing the Recurring Donations 3.10 package. You do not need to do this step if you already have a prior version of the Nonprofit Success Pack package (version 3.0 or later).

plan:reports.title: Install Reports & Dashboards
plan:reports.preflight_message:
The NPSP Reports & Dashboards come with new Trials and installations of NPSP starting at version 3.90 (February 2017). If you started a Trial or installed NPSP before this version, use this installer to add the Reports and Dashboards. For complete information on the NPSP Reports & Dashboards, see the [NPSP Reports Workbook](https://powerofus.force.com/articles/Resource/NPSP-Reports-Workbook).

This installer requires the 5 Opportunity record types included in the standard Nonprofit Starter Pack trial template, and will create them if they don't exist in your org. The installer searches for the record types by Developer Name (not label), so if you changed the Developer Names of the original record types, the installer will add them again. The record type Developer Names are as follows:

* Donation
* MajorGift
* MatchingDonation
* Grant
* Membership
